column4: there are local groups. there are also #ubuntu-xx channels on freenode on several locales
thanks but there's no -el channel
you have to found one :)
well i would if i was good enough with linux..
and also if the locals hanged out more on freenode
it's something to do with fonts i think
advertise your channel on local media and hopefully the gurus will come chat on it
local media don't give a dime about computers and especially linux'
i could try founding one with a friend from debian-dev on the local irc network though
perhaps the local debian community could even help :)
in the meantime i just need the ability to read/write greek in abiword/openoffice
i doubt that
they're mad at ubuntu
sometimes debianites don't like ubuntu that's true. it's not always true on the local level though
well it is particularly true on MY local level
you have the wrong tools
i menant you, not crimsun ^
i wasn't talking about the typing
you actually want to know. that's good
no big deal, it just started churning out thousands of lines with filenames & stuff
the onboard chip might add some confusion. it did for me
